title: If Warwick Was Balanced...
body:
Warwick mains wouldn't be dodging ever time he is banned for their free win. Or people wouldn't be dodging every time he is picked.

Have {{item:3140}} needs to cost 1000 gold, and only have an active.
After this, you have the ability to enchant it, giving you ad, ap, armor, or magic resist. The enchantment costs another 1000 gold. Sounds like a way to buy it and not fall behind to your lane opponent.

If something is overpowered or incredibly frustrating to play against, it deserves to be nerfed, regardless of Lee's balance status.  In my opinion, Warwick is both of those things right now, so he deserves to be nerfed. Lee has nothing whatsoever to do with this conversation.
If a Warwick has Devourer at lvl 6 (2250 gold), something must have gone really wrong (either giving up multiple turrets or not buying anything else like boots or wards)...
He is the single most efficient jungler in the game atm.

I see a lot of the WW doing this. He can power farm really fast compared to most junglers and with the introduction to him in the top lane with smite its usually the first item they rush with a few opting to finish a Bork first then finishing it. For most WW players its the sustain that they are focusing on and not the MS. WW doesn't need it all that much once he hits 6. Since it doesn't matter if you see him coming or not because when he ults he has you locked down. 

Also its not just him having it at lvl 6 exactly, but that with 1 point in his ult with devourer (lvls 6-10) is actually really strong. I recently played a game as ryze against one and while I had the early game. His healing out scaled my damage in the mid-late game. He would just ult me and get 1 combo off and I'd be down to half health and forced to either back or if my ult was up spam it so I could heal up. 

The smite advantage that he gets can't be ignored either. He smites you and does extra true damage which is then free with his ult. So you are actually taking even more damage because of the smite and then he heals instantly and can typically walk out or chase you down very easily. 

Ofc this is still early and it is without a doubt very strong and I lean to say that he needs a nerf atm, but it could just be the knee jerk reaction and more about not knowing the counter play.

I agree it is the sustain that makes WW op, however if you hit his sustain too hard he will rarely make it to 6 before his lanes lose too hard or he falls way behind.  His early clear is awful slow, so he needs sustain.  Unless you want to Olaf him.

Buff the base damage on his ult and remove the application of on-hit effects. In addition, keep the ability to apply Eternal Thirst since it's his passive.

Warwick is now balanced. He's still a noticeable threat even while building tanky due to his utility and increased base damage, but now he isn't "Press R to Win" easy since he's forced to be less reliant on his ultimate to deal all that free bull\*\*** damage that he gets until you build a Quicksilver Sash (and even then he gets free true damage from Challenging Smite, and %currentHP physical damage from Blade of the Ruined King; if he has a Wit's End, too, and your Sash is on cooldown, good luck).

Nothing else needs to change. The on-hit effects applied x5 with no retaliation during his ultimate is the only thing making Warwick a game-breaking \*\***.

Proposed base damage change: ~~250 / 335 / 420~~ â‡’ 300 / 400 / 500

This doesn't stop him from being a boring-ass piece of \*\***, but it does give him true counterplay beyond a Quicksilver Sash since his abilities will only do magic damage, while he stays a physical damage threat with Blade of the Ruined King.

TFW Warwick was never picked before 4.20 and nobody complained about him.  Ah the fickleness of the LoL community is rearing its ugly head again.  I'm not saying WW isn't OP, I could jungle Warwick without taking health pots pre 4.20, but this is solely a meta issue, simply due to the fact that his ganks are horrible pre-6.  Now that it's about sustain instead of early invades, naturally Warwick, Fiddlesticks, and Nunu rose to the top.

It's not the sustain, it's that due to his ult's interaction with new jungle items it does ~500 damage at level 6, with 165 of that being true damage. With devourer that damage jumps to ~700 with level 1 ult ~lvl 6-7. Smite-> R-> Q instagibs squishies with skirmisher's sabre and devourer.

Level 18 full build WW with Devourer, Wit's End, Skirmisher's sabre does at least 1467 damage before resists with ult alone. About 25% of that is true damage. Most have been building BotRK too, which could push the damage to 2000 or more depending on how much HP the target has.

420 from ult base, 345 true damage, 192 magic from passive, 210 from Wit's End, and assuming, say, 20 stacks on Devourer 300 damage from that.

I'm not saying WW isn't OP, I could jungle Warwick without taking health pots pre 4.20, but this is solely a meta issue, simply due to the fact that his ganks are horrible pre-6.  Now that it's about sustain instead of early invades, naturally Warwick, Fiddlesticks, and Nunu rose to the top.

I disagree here. While he may not have seen a lot of play before 4.20, (because he is boring), he was strong.  I saw several high Diamond streamers say Warwick was really strong.   By mid game if you could stack your Feral Flare, plus Wits End and Botrk, you could 1v1 any body.  Then you just built defense items and were unkillable.

As long as he wasn't counter jungled too hard(and that was hard in 4.19) or his lanes were too far behind by the time he stacked FF, it was almost an auto win.
Before there wasn't an item that was almost auto kill on any squishy without QSS or Cleanse. It's not the champ alone that is at fault, it's the jungle rework+item+champ.
